trans-unit.source: Configure VPN connection between two virtual networks | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Configure VPN connection between two virtual networks | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure VPN connections and domain name resolution between two Azure virtual networks, and how to configure HBase geo-replication.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure VPN connections and domain name resolution between two Azure virtual networks, and how to configure HBase geo-replication.

trans-unit.source: Configure a VPN connection between two Azure virtual networks
trans-unit.target: Configure a VPN connection between two Azure virtual networks

trans-unit.source: Azure virtual network site-to-site connectivity uses a VPN gateway to provide a secure tunnel using Ipsec/IKE.
trans-unit.target: Azure virtual network site-to-site connectivity uses a VPN gateway to provide a secure tunnel using Ipsec/IKE.

trans-unit.source: The VNets can be in different subscriptions and different regions.
trans-unit.target: The VNets can be in different subscriptions and different regions.

trans-unit.source: You can even combine VNet to VNet communication with multi-site configurations.
trans-unit.target: You can even combine VNet to VNet communication with multi-site configurations.

trans-unit.source: There are several reasons for VNet to VNet connectivity:
trans-unit.target: There are several reasons for VNet to VNet connectivity:

trans-unit.source: Cross region geo-redundancy and geo-presence
trans-unit.target: Cross region geo-redundancy and geo-presence

trans-unit.source: Regional multi-tier applications with strong isolation boundary
trans-unit.target: Regional multi-tier applications with strong isolation boundary

trans-unit.source: Cross subscription, inter-organization communication in Azure
trans-unit.target: Cross subscription, inter-organization communication in Azure

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Configure a VNet to VNet connection</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Configure a VNet to VNet connection</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To see it on video:
trans-unit.target: To see it on video:

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is a part of the <link><linkText>series[hdinsight-hbase-replication]</linkText><title></title></link> on creating HBase geo-replication.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is a part of the <link><linkText>series[hdinsight-hbase-replication]</linkText><title></title></link> on creating HBase geo-replication.

trans-unit.source: Configure a VPN connectivity between two virtual networks (this tutorial)
trans-unit.target: Configure a VPN connectivity between two virtual networks (this tutorial)

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Configure DNS for the virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-geo-replication-dns]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Configure DNS for the virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-geo-replication-dns]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Configure HBase geo replication[hdinsight-hbase-geo-replication]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Configure HBase geo replication[hdinsight-hbase-geo-replication]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: The following diagram illustrates the two virtual networks you will create in this tutorial:
trans-unit.target: The following diagram illustrates the two virtual networks you will create in this tutorial:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDInsight HBase replication virtual network diagram</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDInsight HBase replication virtual network diagram</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Before running PowerShell scripts, make sure you are connected to your Azure subscription using the following cmdlet:
trans-unit.target: Before running PowerShell scripts, make sure you are connected to your Azure subscription using the following cmdlet:

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, use the following cmdlet to set the current subscription:
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, use the following cmdlet to set the current subscription:

trans-unit.source: Azure service names and virtual machine names must be unique.
trans-unit.target: Azure service names and virtual machine names must be unique.

trans-unit.source: The name used in this tutorial is Contoso-[Azure Service/VM name]-[EU/US].
trans-unit.target: The name used in this tutorial is Contoso-[Azure Service/VM name]-[EU/US].

trans-unit.source: For example, Contoso-VNet-EU is the Azure virtual network in the North Europe data center; Contoso-DNS-US is the DNS server VM in the East U.S. datacenter.
trans-unit.target: For example, Contoso-VNet-EU is the Azure virtual network in the North Europe data center; Contoso-DNS-US is the DNS server VM in the East U.S. datacenter.

trans-unit.source: You must come up with your own names.
trans-unit.target: You must come up with your own names.

trans-unit.source: Create two Azure VNets
trans-unit.target: Create two Azure VNets

trans-unit.source: To create a virtual network called Contoso-VNet-EU in North-Europe
trans-unit.target: To create a virtual network called Contoso-VNet-EU in North-Europe

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click NEW, NETWORK SERVICES, VIRTUAL NETWORK, CUSTOM CREATE.
trans-unit.target: Click NEW, NETWORK SERVICES, VIRTUAL NETWORK, CUSTOM CREATE.

trans-unit.source: Enter:
trans-unit.target: Enter:

trans-unit.source: NAME: Contoso-VNet-EU
trans-unit.target: NAME: Contoso-VNet-EU

trans-unit.source: LOCATION: North Europe
trans-unit.target: LOCATION: North Europe

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses North Europe and East US datacenters.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses North Europe and East US datacenters.

trans-unit.source: You can choose your own datacenters.
trans-unit.target: You can choose your own datacenters.

trans-unit.source: Enter:
trans-unit.target: Enter:

trans-unit.source: DNS SERVER: (Leave it blank)
trans-unit.target: DNS SERVER: (Leave it blank)

trans-unit.source: You will need your own DNS server for name resolution within virtual networks.
trans-unit.target: You will need your own DNS server for name resolution within virtual networks.

trans-unit.source: For more information on when to use Azure-provided name resolution and when to use your own DNS server, see <link><linkText>Name Resolution (DNS)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on when to use Azure-provided name resolution and when to use your own DNS server, see <link><linkText>Name Resolution (DNS)</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For instructions to configure name resolution between VNets, see <link><linkText>Configure DNS between two Azure virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-dns]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions to configure name resolution between VNets, see <link><linkText>Configure DNS between two Azure virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-dns]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Configure a point-to-site VPN: (unchecked)
trans-unit.target: Configure a point-to-site VPN: (unchecked)

trans-unit.source: Point-to-site doesn't apply to this scenario.
trans-unit.target: Point-to-site doesn't apply to this scenario.

trans-unit.source: Configure a site-to-site VPN: (unchecked)
trans-unit.target: Configure a site-to-site VPN: (unchecked)

trans-unit.source: You will configure the site-to-site VPN connection to the Azure virtual network in the East U.S. datacenter.
trans-unit.target: You will configure the site-to-site VPN connection to the Azure virtual network in the East U.S. datacenter.

trans-unit.source: Enter:
trans-unit.target: Enter:

trans-unit.source: ADDRESS SPACE STARTING IP: 10.1.0.0
trans-unit.target: ADDRESS SPACE STARTING IP: 10.1.0.0

trans-unit.source: ADDRESS SPACE CIDR: /16
trans-unit.target: ADDRESS SPACE CIDR: /16

trans-unit.source: Subnet-1 STARTING IP: 10.1.0.0
trans-unit.target: Subnet-1 STARTING IP: 10.1.0.0

trans-unit.source: Subnet-1 CIDR: /24
trans-unit.target: Subnet-1 CIDR: /24

trans-unit.source: The address space can not overlap with the U.S. virtual network.
trans-unit.target: The address space can not overlap with the U.S. virtual network.

trans-unit.source: To create a virtual network called Contoso-VNet-EU in West-Europe
trans-unit.target: To create a virtual network called Contoso-VNet-EU in West-Europe

trans-unit.source: Repeat the last procedure with the following values:
trans-unit.target: Repeat the last procedure with the following values:

trans-unit.source: NAME: Contoso-VNet-US
trans-unit.target: NAME: Contoso-VNet-US

trans-unit.source: LOCATION: East US
trans-unit.target: LOCATION: East US

trans-unit.source: DNS SERVER: (leave it blank)
trans-unit.target: DNS SERVER: (leave it blank)

trans-unit.source: Configure a point-to-site VPN: (unchecked)
trans-unit.target: Configure a point-to-site VPN: (unchecked)

trans-unit.source: Configure a site-to-site VPN: (unchecked)
trans-unit.target: Configure a site-to-site VPN: (unchecked)

trans-unit.source: ADDRESS SPACE STARTING IP: 10.2.0.0
trans-unit.target: ADDRESS SPACE STARTING IP: 10.2.0.0

trans-unit.source: ADDRESS SPACE CIDR: /16
trans-unit.target: ADDRESS SPACE CIDR: /16

trans-unit.source: Subnet-1 STARTING IP: 10.2.0.0
trans-unit.target: Subnet-1 STARTING IP: 10.2.0.0

trans-unit.source: Subnet-1 CIDR: /24
trans-unit.target: Subnet-1 CIDR: /24

trans-unit.source: Configure a VPN connection between the two VNets
trans-unit.target: Configure a VPN connection between the two VNets

trans-unit.source: Create local networks
trans-unit.target: Create local networks

trans-unit.source: When you create a VNet to VNet configuration, you need to configure each VNet to identify each other as a local network site.
trans-unit.target: When you create a VNet to VNet configuration, you need to configure each VNet to identify each other as a local network site.

trans-unit.source: In this section, you’ll configure each VNet as a local network.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you’ll configure each VNet as a local network.

trans-unit.source: The local networks share the same IP address spaces with the corresponding VNet.
trans-unit.target: The local networks share the same IP address spaces with the corresponding VNet.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Azure VPN site-to-site configuration - azure local networks</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Azure VPN site-to-site configuration - azure local networks</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To create a local network called Contoso-LNet-EU matching the Contoso-VNet-EU network address space
trans-unit.target: To create a local network called Contoso-LNet-EU matching the Contoso-VNet-EU network address space

trans-unit.source: From the Azure portal, click NEW, NETWORK SERVICES, VIRTUAL NETWORK, ADD LOCAL NETWORK.
trans-unit.target: From the Azure portal, click NEW, NETWORK SERVICES, VIRTUAL NETWORK, ADD LOCAL NETWORK.

trans-unit.source: Enter:
trans-unit.target: Enter:

trans-unit.source: NAME: Contoso-LNet-EU
trans-unit.target: NAME: Contoso-LNet-EU

trans-unit.source: VPN DEVICE IP ADDRESS: 192.168.0.1 (this address will be updated later)
trans-unit.target: VPN DEVICE IP ADDRESS: 192.168.0.1 (this address will be updated later)

trans-unit.source: Typically, you’d use the actual external IP address for a VPN device.
trans-unit.target: Typically, you’d use the actual external IP address for a VPN device.

trans-unit.source: For VNet to VNet configurations, you will use the VPN gateway IP address.
trans-unit.target: For VNet to VNet configurations, you will use the VPN gateway IP address.

trans-unit.source: Given that you have not created the VPN gateways for the two VNets yet, you enter an arbitary IP address and come back to fix it.
trans-unit.target: Given that you have not created the VPN gateways for the two VNets yet, you enter an arbitary IP address and come back to fix it.

trans-unit.source: Enter:
trans-unit.target: Enter:

trans-unit.source: ADDRESS SPACE STARTING IP: 10.1.0.0
trans-unit.target: ADDRESS SPACE STARTING IP: 10.1.0.0

trans-unit.source: ADDRESS SPACE CIDR: /16
trans-unit.target: ADDRESS SPACE CIDR: /16

trans-unit.source: This must correspond exactly to the range that you specified earlier for Contoso-VNet-EU.
trans-unit.target: This must correspond exactly to the range that you specified earlier for Contoso-VNet-EU.

trans-unit.source: To create a local network called Contoso-LNet-US matching the Contoso-VNet-US network address space
trans-unit.target: To create a local network called Contoso-LNet-US matching the Contoso-VNet-US network address space

trans-unit.source: Repeat the last procedure with the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: Repeat the last procedure with the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: NAME: Contoso-LNet-US
trans-unit.target: NAME: Contoso-LNet-US

trans-unit.source: VPN DEVICE IP ADDRESS: 192.168.0.1 (this address will be updated later)
trans-unit.target: VPN DEVICE IP ADDRESS: 192.168.0.1 (this address will be updated later)

trans-unit.source: ADDRESS SPACE STARTING IP: 10.2.0.0
trans-unit.target: ADDRESS SPACE STARTING IP: 10.2.0.0

trans-unit.source: ADDRESS SPACE CIDR: /16
trans-unit.target: ADDRESS SPACE CIDR: /16

trans-unit.source: Create VPN gateways
trans-unit.target: Create VPN gateways

trans-unit.source: There are two parts in this configuration.
trans-unit.target: There are two parts in this configuration.

trans-unit.source: First you configure a VNet site-to-site connection to a local network, and then you create a dynamic routing VPN.
trans-unit.target: First you configure a VNet site-to-site connection to a local network, and then you create a dynamic routing VPN.

trans-unit.source: VNet to VNet requires Azure VPN gateways with dynamic routing VPNs.
trans-unit.target: VNet to VNet requires Azure VPN gateways with dynamic routing VPNs.

trans-unit.source: Azure static routing VPNs are not supported.
trans-unit.target: Azure static routing VPNs are not supported.

trans-unit.source: To configure the Contoso-VNet-EU site-to-site connection to Contoso-LNet-US
trans-unit.target: To configure the Contoso-VNet-EU site-to-site connection to Contoso-LNet-US

trans-unit.source: From the Azure portal, click NETWORKS on the left pane,
trans-unit.target: From the Azure portal, click NETWORKS on the left pane,

trans-unit.source: Click Contoso-VNet-EU.
trans-unit.target: Click Contoso-VNet-EU.

trans-unit.source: Click the CONFIGUE tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the CONFIGUE tab.

trans-unit.source: Check Connect to local network.
trans-unit.target: Check Connect to local network.

trans-unit.source: In LOCAL NETWORK, select Contoso-LNet-US.
trans-unit.target: In LOCAL NETWORK, select Contoso-LNet-US.

trans-unit.source: Click Add gateway subnet in the virtual network address spaces section.
trans-unit.target: Click Add gateway subnet in the virtual network address spaces section.

trans-unit.source: Click SAVE.
trans-unit.target: Click SAVE.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to confirm.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to confirm.

trans-unit.source: To create a VPN gateway for Contoso-VNet-EU
trans-unit.target: To create a VPN gateway for Contoso-VNet-EU

trans-unit.source: From the Azure portal, click the DASHBOARD tab.
trans-unit.target: From the Azure portal, click the DASHBOARD tab.

trans-unit.source: Click CREATE GATEWAY on the bottom of the page, and then click Dynamic Routing.
trans-unit.target: Click CREATE GATEWAY on the bottom of the page, and then click Dynamic Routing.

trans-unit.source: Click Yes to confirm.
trans-unit.target: Click Yes to confirm.

trans-unit.source: Notice the gateway graphic on the page changes to yellow and says Creating Gateway.
trans-unit.target: Notice the gateway graphic on the page changes to yellow and says Creating Gateway.

trans-unit.source: It typically takes about 15 minutes for the gateway to create.
trans-unit.target: It typically takes about 15 minutes for the gateway to create.

trans-unit.source: When the gateway status changes to Connecting, the IP address for each Gateway will be visible in the Dashboard.
trans-unit.target: When the gateway status changes to Connecting, the IP address for each Gateway will be visible in the Dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Write down the IP address that corresponds to each VNet, taking care not to mix them up.
trans-unit.target: Write down the IP address that corresponds to each VNet, taking care not to mix them up.

trans-unit.source: These are the IP addresses that will be used when you edit your placeholder IP addresses for the VPN Device in Local Networks.
trans-unit.target: These are the IP addresses that will be used when you edit your placeholder IP addresses for the VPN Device in Local Networks.

trans-unit.source: Make a copy of the GATEWAY IP ADDRESS.
trans-unit.target: Make a copy of the GATEWAY IP ADDRESS.

trans-unit.source: You will use it to configure the VPN gateway IP address for Contoso-VNet-EU in the next section.
trans-unit.target: You will use it to configure the VPN gateway IP address for Contoso-VNet-EU in the next section.

trans-unit.source: To create a VPN gateway for Contoso-VNet-EU
trans-unit.target: To create a VPN gateway for Contoso-VNet-EU

trans-unit.source: Repeat the last two procedure to configure the Contoso-VNet-US site-to-site connectivity to Contoso-LNet-EU, and the creat a VPN gateway for Contoso-Vnet-US.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the last two procedure to configure the Contoso-VNet-US site-to-site connectivity to Contoso-LNet-EU, and the creat a VPN gateway for Contoso-Vnet-US.

trans-unit.source: When you are done, you will have the VPN gateway IP address for Contoso-VNet-US.
trans-unit.target: When you are done, you will have the VPN gateway IP address for Contoso-VNet-US.

trans-unit.source: Set the VPN device IP addresses for local networks
trans-unit.target: Set the VPN device IP addresses for local networks

trans-unit.source: In the last section, you create a VPN gateway for each of the VNets.
trans-unit.target: In the last section, you create a VPN gateway for each of the VNets.

trans-unit.source: You have got the IP addresses of the VPN gateways.
trans-unit.target: You have got the IP addresses of the VPN gateways.

trans-unit.source: Now you can go back to configure local network VPN device IP addresses.
trans-unit.target: Now you can go back to configure local network VPN device IP addresses.

trans-unit.source: To configure the VPN device IP address for Contoso-LNet-EU
trans-unit.target: To configure the VPN device IP address for Contoso-LNet-EU

trans-unit.source: From the Azure portal, click NETWORKS on the left pane.
trans-unit.target: From the Azure portal, click NETWORKS on the left pane.

trans-unit.source: Click LOCAL NETWORKS from the top.
trans-unit.target: Click LOCAL NETWORKS from the top.

trans-unit.source: Click Contoso-LNet-EU, and then click EDIT on the bottom.
trans-unit.target: Click Contoso-LNet-EU, and then click EDIT on the bottom.

trans-unit.source: Update VPN DEVICE IP ADDRESS.
trans-unit.target: Update VPN DEVICE IP ADDRESS.

trans-unit.source: This is the address you get from the DASHBOARD tab of Contoso-VNET-EU.
trans-unit.target: This is the address you get from the DASHBOARD tab of Contoso-VNET-EU.

trans-unit.source: Click the right button.
trans-unit.target: Click the right button.

trans-unit.source: Click the check button.
trans-unit.target: Click the check button.

trans-unit.source: To configure the VPN device IP address for Contoso-LNet-US
trans-unit.target: To configure the VPN device IP address for Contoso-LNet-US

trans-unit.source: Repeat the last procedure to configure the VPN device IP address for Contoso-LNet-US.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the last procedure to configure the VPN device IP address for Contoso-LNet-US.

trans-unit.source: Set VNet gateway keys
trans-unit.target: Set VNet gateway keys

trans-unit.source: The Vnet gateways use a shared key to authenticate connections between the virtual networks.
trans-unit.target: The Vnet gateways use a shared key to authenticate connections between the virtual networks.

trans-unit.source: The key can't be configured from the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: The key can't be configured from the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: You must use PowerShell or .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: You must use PowerShell or .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: To set the keys
trans-unit.target: To set the keys

trans-unit.source: From your workstation, open Windows PowerShell ISE or the Windows PowerShell console.
trans-unit.target: From your workstation, open Windows PowerShell ISE or the Windows PowerShell console.

trans-unit.source: Update the parameters in this follow script and run it:
trans-unit.target: Update the parameters in this follow script and run it:

trans-unit.source: Check the VPN connection
trans-unit.target: Check the VPN connection

trans-unit.source: Without any VMs deployed to the VNets, you can use the virtual network visual diagram the VNet Dashboard page on the Azure portal to check the connection status:
trans-unit.target: Without any VMs deployed to the VNets, you can use the virtual network visual diagram the VNet Dashboard page on the Azure portal to check the connection status:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDInsight HBase replication virtual network VPN connection status</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDInsight HBase replication virtual network VPN connection status</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial you have learned how to configure a VPN connection between two Azure virtual networks.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial you have learned how to configure a VPN connection between two Azure virtual networks.
